page.title: 07RELIGION
page.content: The Presbyterian chapel which accommodates over 300 is seldom full nowadays except on special occasions like the Cymanfa Ganu when Welsh voices are raised in a glory of sound. There is a regular singing practice. A service is conducted most Sundays, the regular minister living at Cemmaes. 20 children attend Sunday school and there is a children's service every Christmas. The bible class is not as well attended as in former years. The cost of maintainance is constantly rising and can only present a worrying future. The smaller Congregational chapel is in a similar postion. Some villagers attend church at Cemmaes or Mallwyd. The burial ground for the 2 chapels was given by Major Walton of Cwmllecoediog & a committee of members of both chapels superintends its upkeep.
